intro: Stisseria rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed stisseria, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Stisseria rufescens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. Its medicinal properties have been traditionally used by indigenous peoples for various health purposes.
